response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_25] This bill repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_26] All unencumbered funds in the repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the credit of the newly established University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_17]",
  "appropriations": "The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] An earlier version of the bill intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27] The final version of the bill does not contain an appropriation. [CHUNK_28]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_21]",
  "agency_impact": "This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii system. [CHUNK_4] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [CHUNK_4] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [CHUNK_2]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_21]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_12] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1]",
  "revenue_sources": "There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. [CHUNK_17]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_21]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. [CHUNK_3]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [CHUNK_21]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_21]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This fiscal note is based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. [CHUNK_30] The previous version of the bill included a provision to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] The Committee also made technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [CHUNK_28]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_21]",
  "appropriations_changes": "A previous version of the measure was intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27] The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] Therefore, the C.D. 1 version of the bill contains no appropriation. [CHUNK_28]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "As the appropriation has been removed, there are no changes to funding sources because there is no appropriation to be funded. [CHUNK_28]",
  "department_impact": "The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the University of Hawaii remains the relevant entity for the revolving fund. [CHUNK_2]",
  "reports_required": "The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [CHUNK_6] This report must account for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_7]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided documents do not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_21]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [CHUNK_21]",
  "effective_date": "This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [CHUNK_18] The previous version of the bill had a separate effective date for an appropriation section, which has now been removed. [CHUNK_28]"
}

  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_25] This bill repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_26] All unencumbered funds in the repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the credit of the newly established University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_17]",
  "appropriations": "The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] An earlier version of the bill intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund.   "agency_impact": "This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii system. [CHUNK_4] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [CHUNK_4] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [CHUNK_2]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_21]",

[CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_12] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1]",
  "revenue_sources": "There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act.   "operating_revenue_impact": "The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [CHUNK_30] The previous version of the bill included a provision to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] The Committee also made technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [CHUNK_28]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_21]",
  "appropriations_changes": "A previous version of the measure was intended to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27] The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by removing the appropriation. [CHUNK_28] Therefore, the C.D. 1 version of the bill contains no appropriation. [CHUNK_28]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "As the appropriation has been removed, there are no changes to funding sources because there is no appropriation to be funded. [CHUNK_28]",
  "department_impact": "The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the University of Hawaii remains the relevant entity for the revolving fund. [CHUNK_2]",

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB1169 CD1 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 C.D. 1 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A,

LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to subpart D of part V to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university

conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with

All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the

fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference

with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard

other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income

the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund

Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at

revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals,

not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at

103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3.

of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and

conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the

or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare

and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report

chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center

center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored.

repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 6. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among

administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference

Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. CCR138 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 138 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended

Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of

among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (2) Repeal the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund; (3) Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of

of the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee on Conference has amended

Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Removing the appropriation; and (2) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to

managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No.

Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE ____________________________ DONNA MERCADO KIM Chair ____________________________ ANDREW TAKUYA GARRETT Co-Chair ____________________________ TROY N. HASHIMOTO
Chair ____________________________ ANDREW TAKUYA GARRETT Co-Chair ____________________________ TROY N. HASHIMOTO Co-Chair ____________________________ DANIEL HOLT Co-Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

HB1169_CD1_CCR138_.chunk_text: HB1169 CD1 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 C.D. 1 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A,

LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to subpart D of part V to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university

conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with

All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the

fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference

with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard

other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income

the convening of each regular session, accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund

Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at

revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals,

not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at

103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3.

of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and

conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the

or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare

and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report

chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund and in the community college conference center

center revolving fund and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored.

repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 6. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among

administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference

Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. CCR138 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 138 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended

Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of

among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (2) Repeal the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund; (3) Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of

of the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee on Conference has amended

Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Removing the appropriation; and (2) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to

managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No.

Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1.
